text.0: come thou to what the stones have pressed drink soma o thou somas lord.
text.1: indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong.
text.2: strong is the stone the draught is strong strong is this soma that is pressed.
text.3: indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong.
text.4: as strong i call on thee the strong o thunderarmed with various aids.
text.5: indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong.
text.6: impetuous thunderer strong quelling the mighty king potent vṛtraslayer somadrinker.
text.7: may he come hither with his yoked bay horses may indra gladden him at the noon libation.
text.8: o sūrya when the asuras descendant svarbhanu pierced thee through and through with darkness.
text.9: all creatures looked like one who is bewildered who knoweth not the place where he is standing.
text.10: what time thou smotest down svarbhanus magic that spread itself beneath the sky o indra.
text.11: by his fourth sacred prayer atri disoovered sūrya concealed in gloom that stayed his function.
text.12: let not the oppressor with this dread through anger swallow me up for i am thine o atri.
text.13: mitra art thou the sender of true blessings thou and king varuṇa be both my helpers.
text.14: the brahman atri as he set the pressstones serving the gods with praise and adoration.
text.15: established in the heaven the eye of sūrya and caused svarbhanus magic arts to vanish.
text.16: the atris found the sun again him whom svarbhanu of the brood.
text.17: of asuras had pierced with gloom this none besides had power to do.
